intro: Seseli lancifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. It is native to parts of Europe and western Asia. Due to its habitat preferences, it is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
